result.execSummary:
The defendant Mason K Ortega was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Bail Applied. Fine paid in full.
Bail applied. Restitution for Ace Hardware paid in full along with surcharges.

Bail Applied. Costs paid in full.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mason K Ortega

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Case called at 2:40 PM 
District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Mason K Ortega in court with attorney J Andrew Herbers.  
Court conducts plea colloquy with the defendant.
Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to Count 1.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of Count 1.
State makes sentencing recommendations.
Defense makes sentencing recommendations.
Defendant makes statements.

COUNT 1
Court orders the following:
46- DAYS JAIL
Credit time 46-DAYS
COURT CONSIDERS TIME SERVED.

RESTITUTION:  $50.79 - to Ace Hardware (to be paid as a condition of probation - restitution to be paid before costs or fines);
FINE:  $389.00
DR GOD SURCHARGE:  $10.00
DNA SAMPLE AND SURCHARGE:  $200.00
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
*Cash Bail in the amount of $75.98 from this case  is to be applied to Restitution/fine/surcharges*
*Cash Bail from case 22CM0632 in the amount of $1,000.00 to be applied towards Restitution/fine/and surcharges - balance to be refunded to the Poster*
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 11, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Atty Herbers enters a speedy trial demand on 22CM632 and 22CM633. Atty Herbers requests to set jury trial on 22CM632 first.

Atty Herbers requests a bail to be lowered, or modified to include huber bailee. Court will set bail motion. 

06/03 at 9:00 am for bail motion. Trial order will be uploaded.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for June 3, 2022 at 09:00 am.  Jury status hearing scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 02:30 pm.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Hearing scheduled for May 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
